Description: Concave foot of an Attic pottery lamp with the incised letters alpha and rho and the mark of the nozzle-piercing tool. Glazed save for underside, which has glaze dribble. Fine orange fabric
Curator's comments: Parallel from Athens (Howland 1958, Types 24C, 25A-B, dated 450BC - 350BC and 350BC - 275BC). Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals. Princeton.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q90)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 560)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.41) (Phase 1)
